contextId.occurrenceNote: The "harvest of the Nile" refers to the grain that was harvested near the Nile River and transported on the river and then to Phoenicia. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-possession]])
contextId.glQuote: the harvest of the Nile was her produce

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the times when they are experiencing trouble. Alternate translation: ""when we have troubles" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-possession]])

This means that they have their festival and feasts at this city. Alternate translation: "the city where we have our feasts" or "they city where we celebrate our festivals" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-possession]])

The phrase "the scroll of Yahweh" means that it contains the messages spoken by Yahweh. Alternate translation: "Read carefully what is written in this scroll that contains the messages of Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-possession]])
contextId.glQuote: Search through the scroll of Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that they land is full of natural resources, such as grain. Alternate translation: "a land where there is plenty of grain ... a land where there is plenty of bread" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-possession]])
contextId.glQuote: a land of grain ... a land of bread
